description: The Creation of Japan is the foundational myth of Japanese cosmology, recorded in the Kojiki (712 CE) and Nihon Shoki (720 CE). After the spontaneous generation of the first kami in Takamagahara (the High Plain of Heaven), the divine couple Izanagi and Izanami descended to the primordial ocean and stirred the cosmic waters with a jeweled spear, giving birth to the islands of Japan and the myriad kami that inhabit them.

name: Japanese Mythology
definition: The foundational Shinto creation myth where the divine couple Izanagi and Izanami create the Japanese islands and the myriad kami through sacred ritual, establishing the divine origin and sanctity of Japan.
examples: The Heavenly Jeweled Spear stirring primordial ocean
Brine dripping from the spear creating the first island
The divine couple's sacred circumambulation ritual
Birth of eight major islands and countless kami
applications: Establishing sacred geography and land sanctity
Marriage and partnership rituals honoring divine couple
National identity and spiritual connection to landscape
